steps.title: SU stands for â€œSwipe Upâ€ on Snapchat Stories.
steps.content: SU stands for â€œSwipe Upâ€ on Snapchat Stories. Platforms like Snapchat let users embed links in their Snapchat Stories. When you view Snapchat Stories , you can get to the link by swiping up on your screen, which redirects you to the embedded website. [1] X Research source On unlinked Snapchat Stories, swiping up toggles a â€œreplyâ€ feature, which lets you DM the original poster. Some Snapchatters use â€œS/Uâ€ instead of â€œSUâ€ for this purpose. Both abbreviations mean â€œSwipe Up,â€ though! â€œSU for 10% off your order! ğŸ¤‘â€ â€œSU for a compliment ğŸ’›â€ Instagram used to have a swipe up feature, but the platform got rid of it in 2021. steps.content: Invite a follower to check out a link. Maybe youâ€™re hoping to share your Amazon wishlist around, or youâ€™ve got a promo code to a cool merch site. steps.content: Encourage your followers to send you a DM. Add a new post to your Snapchat Story where you encourage your friends to swipe up and message you. steps.content: Casually tell someone to shut up with SU. Maybe your friend is giving you a hard time about something, or your parents are teasing you in the family group chat. Playfully put your foot down by sending a quick SU. Friend: â€œHeard that someone likes Tyler ğŸ˜œâ€ You: â€œSU!! ğŸ˜–â€

steps.content: Use SU as a replacement for a quick goodbye . Your group chat convo is starting to wrap things up, but you donâ€™t have enough time write out a full reply. Keep things short by signing off with a quick SU. [6] X Research source Friend: â€œGotta go. See ya later!â€ You: â€œSU!â€

steps.title: You donâ€™t need to reply to a â€œSwipe Upâ€ link.
steps.content: You donâ€™t need to reply to a â€œSwipe Upâ€ link. â€œSwipe Upâ€ is used in Snapchat Stories to redirect users to a new webpage. Youâ€™re welcome to use the link, but you definitely donâ€™t have to reply to it.

steps.content: Playfully dish it back to a friend who tells you to shut up. steps.content: Say â€œbyeâ€ if the other person just sent a â€œSee Youâ€ message. If the other person is signing off, feel free to send a friendly sign-off of your own! â€œGoodbye,â€ â€œBye,â€ â€œGreat talking to you,â€ and â€œTalk soonâ€ are all nice options. Them: â€œSU!â€ You: â€œBye! ğŸ‘‹â€
